alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Fernando Valley; Eastern Santa Monica Mountains Recreational Area; Los Angeles County Beaches; Los Angeles County Inland Coast including Downtown Los Angeles; Malibu Coast; Western San Fernando Valley; Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 2:56AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Los Angeles County through 330 AM PDT... At 254 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong storms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from Sherman Oaks to near Marina Del Rey. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Van Nuys, Culver City, Burbank, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Hollywood, Bel Air, Studio City, Century City, Hollywood Hills, Marina Del Rey, Sherman Oaks, Pacoima, Sunland and Pacific Palisades. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in OXNARD.
